19 
30 cv::Mat Segment(Mat img){
31  //create the result image the same dimensions as the original
32  int img_row = img.rows;
33  int img_col = img.cols;
34  Mat resultImg(img_row, img_col, CV_32F, cv::Scalar(100));
35 
36  //iterate through the image
37  for(int i = 0; i < img_row; i++){
38  for(int j = 0; j < img_col; j++){
39  resultImg.at<float>(i, j) = 2* (int)img.at<Vec3b>(i, j)[0] - (int)img.at<Vec3b>(i, j)[1] - (int)img.at<Vec3b>(i, j)[2]; //2B-R-G img = BGR
40  }
41 
42  }
43 
44  //converte the result image to 8U
45  resultImg.convertTo(resultImg, CV_8U);
46 
47  return resultImg;
48 }

78 cv::Mat Camera::imageCb(const sensor_msgs::ImageConstPtr& msg)
79  {
80  cv_bridge::CvImagePtr cv_ptr;
81  cv::Mat image;
82  try
83  {
84  cv_ptr = cv_bridge::toCvCopy(msg, sensor_msgs::image_encodings::BGR8);
85  image = cv_ptr->image;
86  return image;
87  }
88  catch (cv_bridge::Exception& e)
89  {
90  ROS_ERROR("cv_bridge exception: %s", e.what());
91  return image;
92  }
93  }

103 Camera::Camera()
104 {
105  ros::NodeHandle node("~");
106 
107  sub_camera = node.subscribe("sub_topic", 1000, &Camera::callbackCamera, this); //Camera-image
108 
109  tf_pub = node.advertise<std_msgs::String>("pub_cam_tf", 1);
110 
111 }
112 
122 void Camera::callbackCamera(const sensor_msgs::ImageConstPtr& cameraImage)
123 {
124  if(cameraImage->width != 0){
125  m_cameraImage = imageCb(cameraImage);
126  ImageProcessing();
127  }
128  tf_pub.publish(output);
129 }
130 
131 
132 
143 void Camera::ImageProcessing(){
144  //get a copy of the current frame
145  cv::Mat img = m_cameraImage.clone();
146 
147  //segment by blue
148  cv::Mat img_segment = Segment(img);
149  cv::Mat img_edges, img_result;
150 
151  //get the edges of the segmentd
152  cv::Canny(img_segment, img_edges, 0, 10, 5);
153 
154  //get the countours of the edges
155  vector<vector<cv::Point> > contours;
156  vector<cv::Vec4i> hierarchy;
157  cv::findContours(img_edges.clone(), contours, hierarchy, CV_RETR_CCOMP, CV_CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE);
158 
159  if(contours.size() > 0){
160  //use the contours to find the center of the ball
161  vector<RotatedRect> minEllipse( contours.size() );
162  for( size_t i = 0; i < contours.size(); i++ )
163  {
164  //if the contour is big enough fit an ellips around it
165  if( contours[i].size() > 5 )
166  {
167  minEllipse[i] = fitEllipse( contours[i] );
168  }
169  }
170  //counter to save the biggest ellipse
171  int NumberBiggest = 0;
172 
173  for( size_t i = 0; i < contours.size(); i++ ){
174  //find the widest ellipse
175  if(minEllipse[NumberBiggest].size.width < minEllipse[i].size.width ){
176  NumberBiggest = i;
177  }
178  }
179  cv::Point2f center = minEllipse[NumberBiggest].center;
180  ellipse( img, minEllipse[NumberBiggest], CV_RGB(((int)rand() % 255), ((int)rand() % 255), ((int)rand() % 255)), 2 );
181  circle( img, center, 5, Scalar( 0, 0, 255 ), FILLED, LINE_8 );
182 
183  float image_fifth = img.cols/5;
184  if(center.x <= image_fifth){
185  output.data = "1";
186  }else if(center.x <= image_fifth*2){
187  output.data = "2";
188  }else if(center.x <= image_fifth*3){
189  output.data = "3";
190  }else if(center.x <= image_fifth*4){
191  output.data = "4";
192  }else if(center.x <= image_fifth*5){
193  output.data = "5";
194  }
195 
196  }else{
197  output.data = "0";
198  }
199 
200  cv::imshow("test", img);
201  cv::waitKey(20);
202 }
